content.text: This is a HE WSI of a CRC case, consisting of lymph nodes or primary tumor section. What is your initial impression of this image?

The thumbnail shows a large, irregularly shaped section of tissue. A significant portion is composed of a densely cellular, basophilic area, which is highly suspicious for a malignant tumor. This tumor appears to be infiltrating into the surrounding pinkish stromal and white adipose tissue. In the upper left quadrant, there is a distinct, well-circumscribed, ovoid structure consistent with a lymph node. My first impression is that this slide contains the primary colorectal tumor and at least one regional lymph node, requiring evaluation for tumor characteristics and metastasis.
Are there any places you want to look into further? Give me reasons why you want to look into each region.

The green box is placed over a densely cellular, basophilic area that represents the main tumor mass. I would zoom into this area to confirm the diagnosis of malignancy and to assess its histological features. Specifically, I would be looking at the tumor's morphology (gland formation, cell type), grade (degree of differentiation), and for the presence of adverse features like necrosis or lymphovascular invasion. This area is ideal for characterizing the primary tumor itself before moving on to assess the lymph nodes or the invasion depth. I want to zoom into [coordinates not found].
This is ROI 1 and its 40x cyto pattern. What do you observe when you zoom in?

In this zoomed-in view, I see infiltrating nests and sheets of malignant epithelial cells surrounded by a desmoplastic stroma. The tumor cells exhibit significant pleomorphism, with large, hyperchromatic nuclei and prominent nucleoli. A key feature is the presence of central, eosinophilic, granular debris within the tumor nests, which is characteristic of 'dirty necrosis' or comedonecrosis. My impression is that this is an invasive adenocarcinoma, consistent with a colorectal primary. The presence of solid sheets and prominent necrosis suggests a moderately to poorly differentiated tumor.
